text.headline: Apple Computer Founded
text.text: Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, and Ronald Wayne found Apple Computer in a garage in Cupertino, California.

media.caption: Apple's original founders Steve Wozniak, Steve Jobs, Ron Wayne

text.headline: Apple II Released
text.text: Apple II becomes one of the first successful personal computers with color graphics.

text.headline: Macintosh 128K Released
text.text: Apple introduces the Macintosh with a graphical user interface and mouse, revolutionizing computing.

media.caption: Steve Jobs with the original Macintosh, 8 years after Apple's founding.

text.headline: Steve Jobs Leaves Apple
text.text: Following a power struggle, Steve Jobs resigns from Apple and founds NeXT Inc.

media.caption: Steve Jobs leaves Apple and starts NeXT, his own computer company.

text.headline: Apple Acquires NeXT, Jobs Returns
text.text: Apple acquires NeXT Inc., bringing Steve Jobs back and setting the foundation for macOS.

media.caption: Apple merged with NeXT Computer and Jobs returned to Apple.

text.headline: Mac OS X Released
text.text: Apple launches Mac OS X, based on NeXTSTEP and Unix, with the new Aqua interface.

text.headline: iPod Introduced
text.text: Apple revolutionizes music with the iPod, allowing 1,000 songs in your pocket.

text.headline: iPhone Released
text.text: Apple reinvents the smartphone with the iPhone, featuring a touchscreen and internet capabilities.

media.caption: Steve Jobs presents the original iPhone in 2007.

text.headline: App Store Launched
text.text: The App Store opens with 500 apps, creating a new mobile software ecosystem.

text.headline: iCloud Introduced
text.text: Apple launches iCloud, enabling cloud-based storage and synchronization across Apple devices.

media.caption: Steve Jobs called iCloud Apple's 'hard disk in the sky'.

text.headline: macOS Sierra Introduces Siri
text.text: Apple rebrands OS X to macOS and adds Siri integration.

media.caption: Apple introduced Siri as part of macOS Sierra Desktop

text.headline: Apple Silicon Transition Begins
text.text: Apple announces its transition from Intel processors to its custom M1 chips. M1 is Appleâ€™s first chip designed specifically for the Mac and the most powerful chip it has ever created.
